Wisdom: الرَّاضِي عَنْ نَفْسِهِ مَغْبُونٌ [مَفْتُونٌ‏] وَالْوَاثِقُ بِهَا مَفْتُونٌ [مَغْبُونٌ‏]
enWisdom: One who is pleased with himself is cheated and one who is overconfident is faced with affliction

Wisdom: إِيَّاكَ أَنْ تَرْضَى عَنْ نَفْسِكَ فَيَكْثُرَ السَّاخِطُ عَلَيْكَ
enWisdom: Beware of being pleased with yourself thereby increasing the number of those who are displeased with you

Wisdom: مَنْ رَضِيَ عَنْ نَفْسِهِ كَثُرَ السَّاخِطُ عَلَيْهِ
enWisdom: Whoever is pleased with himself, many are angry with him

Wisdom: بِالرِّضَا عَنِ النَّفْسِ تَظْهَرُ السَّوْءَاتُ وَالْعُيُوبُ
enWisdom: By being pleased with oneself, vices and faults become manifest

Wisdom: رِضَا الْعَبْدِ عَنْ نَفْسِهِ مَقْرُونٌ بِسَخَطِ رَبِّهِ
enWisdom: The person’s satisfaction with himself is [always] accompanied by the displeasure of his Lord

Wisdom: مَنْ رَضِيَ عَنْ نَفْسِهِ أَسْخَطَ رَبَّهُ
enWisdom: Whoever is pleased with himself angers his Lord
Every person who relies on himself [instead of Allah] is thrown [into destruction]

Wisdom: مَنِ اغْتَرَّ بِنَفْسِهِ أَسْلَمَتْهُ إِلَى الْمَعَاطِبِ
enWisdom: Whoever is deceived by his soul is delivered by it to places of destruction

Wisdom: مَنْ رَضِيَ عَنْ نَفْسِهِ ظَهَرَتْ عَلَيْهِ الْمَعَايِبُ
enWisdom: Whoever is pleased with himself, his flaws become known
